module.title: fiach
fiach
module.p: fiach is a masculine abstract common noun, with genitive singular fèich and plural fiachan, descended from Old Gaelic fíach. In modern Scottish Gaelic, fiach has two main sets of uses, relating to the following two senses –

Basic examples –
dìoghail fiach
repay a debt td. 186
Maith dhuinn ar fiachan.
Forgive us our debts. [Biblical] td. 186
fiachan gun dioladh
arrear(s) td. 298
Dhubh e a-mach cùnntas nam fiachan a bha nar n-aghaidh.
He wiped out the account of the debts that were against us. td. 298

A proverb –
Cha tèid fiach air beul dùinte.
A closed mouth doesn’t run into debt. td. 186
Cha tèid fiachan air beul dùinte.
A closed mouth won’t get into debts. td. 298
Idiomatic prepositional compounds using the old dative plural form fiachaibh –

ul.li:
mar fhiachaibh air incumbent upon –
mar fhiachaibh oirnn(e)
incumbent upon us td. 58
Tha e mar fhiachaibh orm facal no dhà a ràdh.
It is incumbent upon me to say a few words. td. 186–7
Tha e mar fhiachaibh air an Riaghaltas seo a dhèanamh.
It is incumbent upon the Government to do this. td. 298
Cha do shaoil e gun robh e mar fhiachaibh air a bhith ...
He did not think that he was obliged to be ... td. 298
Thàinig e mar fhiachaibh air a’ chomann oibreachadh airson aonaidh.
The society was obliged to work for unity. td. 298
cuir mar fhiachaibh air
oblige, compel td. 58
Chuir iad mar fhiachaibh orm an dreuchd a ghabhail.
They obliged me / made me feel obliged to to accept the post. td. 187
Chuir e mar fhiachaibh orm gu a chuideachadh.
He obliged me to help him. td. 187

fo fhiachaibh do indebted to –
fo fhiachaibh
indebted to, owing to td. 58
bi fo fhiachaibh do
owe td. 298
Tha mi fo fhiachaibh dhaibh.
I’m indebted to them. td. 187 Not necessarily financially.
Bha mi fo fhiachaibh mhòra dhaibh.
I was greatly indebted to them / I owed them a great deal. td. 298
Tha sinn fo fhiachan dha [ann] an iomadach dòigh.
We are indebted to him in many ways. td. 298

am fiachaibh indebted –
am fiachaibh
indebted td. 298

module.p:
fiach + measure of value + de –
Thoir dhomh fiach dà nota dheth.
Give me two pounds-worth of it. td. 186
Dh’iarr mi fiach sgillin de shuiteas.
I asked for a pennyworth of sweets. td. 298

lix.gd: An fhiach seo dhut? Chan fhiach.
lix.tr: Is this of value / worth anything to you? No.

li.m: Cha b’ fhiach an cogadh sin (dhuinn)
li.en: That war was not worthwhile (for us)

lix.gd: Aon uair eile? Chan fheuch e!
lix.tr: One more time? It’s not worth it.

module.p: is fhiach (do ...) + infinitival be worth doing

li.m: Is fhiach (dhaibh) a dhol don oilthigh
li.en: Going to university is worthwhile (for them)

li.m: Am b’ fhiach (dhut) an leabhar sin a leughadh?
li.en: Was reading that book worthwhile (for you)?

lix.note: ie. Is fhiach an rud seo fhaicinn.

lix.gd: B’ fhiach sùil a thoirt air.
lix.tr: It would be worth having a look at it.
It wouldn’t be worth keeping them.

lix.gd: Chan fhiach dhaibh am beul fhosgladh.
lix.tr: It’s not worth them opening their mouth(s).

lix.gd: A bheil thu a’ smaoineachadh gum b’fhiach dhut sin a dhèanamh?
lix.tr: Do you think it would be worth your while doing that?

lix.gd: [tachartas] as fhiach a chumail air chuimhne
lix.note: ie. Is fhiach an tachartas seo a chumail air chuimhne

lix.gd: Is ann an seo a chunnaic sinn a’ chiad taigh a b’ fhiach taigh a ràdh ris.
lix.tr: It was here we saw the first house that was worth calling a house.
lix.note: ie. B’ fhiach taigh a ràdh ris an taigh seo.

lix.gd: Cha robh duine a b’fhiach bruidhinn air nach aithneachadh i.
lix.tr: There was nobody worth speaking about that she didn’t know.
lix.note: ie. Cha b’ fhiach bruidhinn air an duine sin.

lix.gd: Bha e a’ faireachdainn nach b’ fhiach a bhith beò.
lix.tr: He felt that it wasn’t worth living.

lix.gd: Am b’fhiach an càradh? B’fhiach / Cha b’fhiach.
lix.tr: Would it be worth mending them? Yes. / No.

module.p:
Examples with a ‘dummy’ subject e (or i) –
’S fhiach e an t-saothair.
It’s worth the effort. td. 58
Chan fhiach e an t-saothair.
It’s not worth the labour/trouble. td. 298
airson na ’s fhiach e
for what it’s worth td. 186
Am b’fhiach e fheuchainn? B’fhiach. / Cha b’fhiach.
Would it be worth trying? Yes. / No. td. 298
’S fhiach e e.
It’s worth it. td. 298
Tha an fhaochag glè phailt agus is fhiach i a h-itheadh.
The whelk is very plentiful and worth its eating td. 298
Co-dhùin e nach b’ fhiach e a shaothair dha.
He decided that it wasn’t worth his while. td. 298

More complicated examples –
duine nach fhiach tromb gun teanga
a worthless/good-for-nothing man [lit. not worth a jew’s harp without a tongue] td. 186
Cha d’ fhiach e.
It’s useless. td. 58
Cha do rinn iad mòran a b’fhiach gu sonas an duine a mheudachadh.
They didn’t do much that was worthwhile to increase the happiness of man. td. 298 ie. Cha b’ fhiach na rinn iad.
Bha dealbh no dhà aige nach b’ fhiach mòran.
He had a picture or two which weren’t worth much. td. 298 Cha b’ fhiach na dealbhan mòran.
Co mheud not a b’fhiach e?
How many pounds was it worth? td. 298 ie. B’ fhiach e fichead not.
Cha b’fhiach an turas an t-saothair.
The journey wasn’t worth it. td. 298
B’fhiach àite dha fhèin bhith aig an ìomhaigh seo.
This statue is worthy of having a place to itself. td. 298 ie. B’ fhiach a bhith àite dha fhèin aig an ìomhaigh seo. ???
Cha b’ fhiach e uiread do Mhairead.
It wasn’t worth as much to Margaret. td. 298

is math as fhiach (do ...) be well worth (doing) –
Is math as fhiach dhut an leabhar seo a leughadh.
It’s well worth your while reading this book. td. 299
Is math as fhiach e a leughadh gu cùramach.
It’s well worth [it] reading [it] carefully. td. 299
Is math as fhiach e a’ phrìs.
It’s well worth the price. td. 299
Bu mhath a b’fhiach e an dàil
The delay was well worth it. td. 299

is geal as fhiach be well worth (doing) –
leabhar as geal as fhiach a cheannach
a book which is well worth buying td. 326
Is geal is fhiach e a leughadh gu cùramach.
It’s well worth reading [it] carefully. td. 326

is gann as fhiach be hardly worth (doing) –
Is gann is fhiach a bhiathadh.
It’s hardly worth its feeding. td. 299

is fhiach le ... be worth one’s while –
Mas fhiach leibh a dh’èisteachd ris ...
If you condescend to listen to it / if you think it’s worth listening to. td. 299
Chan fhiach leam e.
It is beneath me. td. 299

cf. fiachail adj. (comp. fiachaile) worthy, worthwhile –
Tha sinn deònach cuideachadh a thoirt do phròiseactan fiachail.
We are willing to give assistance to worthwhile projects. td. 299
